body.name: A Marquess's Rhapsody of Desire: A Historical Regency Romance Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #78,739 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #598 in Historical Regency Fiction #1,382 in Victorian Historical Romance (Kindle Store) #2,045 in Regency Historical Romance

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Suspense, romancd and a HEA
reviews.reviewText: Greed for title and money leaves our heroine Charlotte an orphaned being raised by her uncaring Uncle who appears to care about nothing but marrying her to the highest bidder. All the while someone is embezzling money from the rich members of the ton of both England and Scotland.Charlotte meets Jameson Sinclair and prays he can care for her instead of those who would use her for their own gain.A great romance and mystery which proceeds with urgency. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Romance with some suspense and a happy ending
reviews.reviewText: Charlotte and Jamison meet and fall in love. However, her uncle doesn’t want her to marry into a powerful family. His family wants him to marry someone they consider more eligible. They throw in many obstacles but in the end love prevails. There is some mystery but most of the readers will have figured it out for themselves. I certainly did.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Families against them.
reviews.reviewText: The heroine and hero have their families set against their union. How they overcome and get their HEA makes for a compelling read. There was a little mystery also to add to the intrigue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wanting each other
reviews.reviewText: This was an interesting story of two people meeting and falling in love but each family is against it for different reasons. Will they overcome and get what they want? I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Connection with music
reviews.reviewText: The greed for title and money leaves Charlotte an orphan to be raised by her uncaring Uncle. All he appears to care about is to marry her to the highest bidder.Someone is embezzling money from the rich members of the ton of both England and Scotland. Charlotte meets Jameson Sinclair and prays he can care for her instead of those put before her. A great urgency romance and mystery which I read as an ARC will be enjoyed by all who read this novel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great read
reviews.reviewText: After her parents died Charlotte's uncle took her in and now, he wants to marry her off. Charlotte and Jameson met at a ball where they were instantly attracted. As they grew closer her uncle was pushing another on her. When she was going through her father's things, she found a letter that changed everything. She had a secret she had to tell Jameson but didn't know how but after she confessed, he sent her away. When a fire at her house almost cost her her life Jameson rescued her, apologizes and asked her to marry him.
